parameters.name: is.multiple.combine.wide
parameters.text: FALSE

autoSize.description:
Automatically evaluates appropriate canvas dimensions considering padding, scaling,
and aspect ratio adjustments for multi-sample imaging displays.

parameters.name: dims
parameters.text:
The dimensions of MSImaging raw data. Can be either:
1. A numeric vector with at least two elements representing [width, height]
2. A list object containing at least two named elements "w" and "h".

parameters.name: padding
parameters.text:
A numeric vector specifying CSS-style padding in the order:
[top, right, bottom, left]. Defines empty space around the imaging data.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.text:
Numeric scaling factor for pixel dimensions (default: 1).
Values >1 enlarge, <1 shrink while maintaining original proportions.

parameters.name: is_multiple_combine_wide
parameters.text:
Logical indicating if wide-format multi-sample
layout should be prioritized (default: FALSE). When FALSE, attempts to
maintain 1:1 aspect ratio by applying ratio scaling when needed.

parameters.name: ratio_threshold
parameters.text:
Numeric threshold for aspect ratio adjustment
(default: 1.25). Triggers dimension scaling when width/height ratio
exceeds this value.

parameters.name: ratio_scale
parameters.text:
Multiplicative factor (default: 1.5) applied to
under-dimensioned axis when aspect ratio exceeds threshold.

autoSize.title: Calculate recommended canvas size for MSImaging visualization

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: 'getOption'('mzdiff', 'default' = 'da:0.3')

geom_red.description:
Generates a ggplot2 layer for mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data visualization
in red color channel corresponding to specified m/z value.

parameters.name: mz
parameters.text: numeric. The target mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) value for ion detection.

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text:
character or numeric. Mass accuracy tolerance in Dalton (Da) format.
Default uses option "mzdiff" if set, otherwise "da:0.3". Format should follow
"da:[value]" for Dalton-based tolerance or "ppm:[value]" for parts-per-million.

geom_red.returns:
A ggplot2 layer object that can be added to existing MSI plots for
multi-channel visualization. Displays ion distribution in red color scale.
geom_red.title: Create red channel MS imaging layer

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: 'getOption'('mzdiff', 'default' = 'da:0.3')

geom_green.description:
Generates a ggplot2 layer for mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data visualization
in green color channel corresponding to specified m/z value.

parameters.name: mz
parameters.text: numeric. The target mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) value for ion detection.

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: character or numeric. Mass accuracy tolerance. See geom_red() for format details.

geom_green.returns: A ggplot2 layer object displaying ion distribution in green color scale.
geom_green.title: Create green channel MS imaging layer

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: 'getOption'('mzdiff', 'default' = 'da:0.3')

geom_blue.description:
Generates a ggplot2 layer for mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data visualization
in blue color channel corresponding to specified m/z value.

parameters.name: mz
parameters.text: numeric. The target mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) value for ion detection.

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: character or numeric. Mass accuracy tolerance. See geom_red() for format details.

geom_blue.returns: A ggplot2 layer object displaying ion distribution in blue color scale.
geom_blue.title: Create blue channel MS imaging layer

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: 'getOption'('mzdiff', 'default' = 'da:0.3')

geom_blanket.description:
Generates a grayscale ggplot2 layer for mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data,
typically used as a background layer or for intensity normalization.

parameters.name: mz
parameters.text: numeric. The target mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) value for ion detection.

parameters.name: tolerance
parameters.text: character or numeric. Mass accuracy tolerance. See geom_red() for format details.

geom_blanket.returns:
A ggplot2 layer object using "Greys" color palette with alpha channel (c8 = 200/255 transparency)
suitable for creating intensity-normalized backgrounds or composite overlays.
geom_blanket.title: Create monochromatic overlay for MS imaging

parameters.text: NULL

PlotMSIMatrixHeatmap.description:
Generates a matrix of mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) heatmaps in grid layout
with intensity filtering, spatial smoothing, and formatted metabolite labels.
Supports custom color schemes, layout configurations, and intensity filters.

parameters.name: ions_data
filters
parameters.text:
Optional custom intensity filter(s) for raster data preprocessing.
If NULL (default), applies Top x% Intensity Quantile (TrIQ) filtering via `MSI_TrIQ`.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.text:
Integer vector of length 2 specifying grid dimensions [rows, columns].
Default: [3,3].

parameters.name: colorSet
parameters.text:
Character specifying color palette name (e.g., "Jet", "viridis").
Default: "Jet".

parameters.name: MSI_TrIQ
parameters.text:
Numeric [0-1] specifying Top x% Intensity Quantile threshold for
default intensity filtering. Values > threshold are clipped. Default: 0.8.

parameters.name: gaussian
parameters.text:
Numeric specifying Gaussian blur radius (in pixels) for spatial
smoothing. Set to 0 to disable. Default: 3.

parameters.name: size
parameters.text:
Integer vector of length 2 specifying canvas dimensions [width, height]
in pixels. Default: [2700, 2000].

parameters.name: canvasPadding
parameters.text:
Integer vector of length 4 specifying canvas margins
[top, right, bottom, left] in pixels. Default: [50, 300, 50, 50].

parameters.name: cellPadding
parameters.text:
Integer vector of length 4 specifying grid cell margins
[top, right, bottom, left] in pixels. Default: [200, 100, 0, 100].

parameters.name: font_size
parameters.text: Numeric specifying base font size for labels. Default: 27.

parameters.name: strict
parameters.text: Logical. If TRUE, enforces dimension consistency checks. Default: TRUE.

parameters.name: msi_dimension
parameters.text:
Optional integer vector of length 2 specifying output dimensions
[width, height] for rasterization. If NULL, uses native data dimensions.

PlotMSIMatrixHeatmap.title: Plot MS-Imaging Heatmap Matrix in Grid Layout

parameters.text: './Rplot.png'

MSI_ionStatPlot.description:
Generates a composite visualization combining statistical charts (e.g., bar/box/violin plots)
with mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data. Outputs to specified PNG file with customizable layout.
MSI_ionStatPlot.details:
The function performs three main operations:
1. Computes ANOVA group statistics using \code{ANOVAGroup()}
2. Creates a statistical plot (bar/box/violin) with significance annotations
3. Generates MS ion image with optional spatial region overlays
Plots are combined using a customizable split-layout system. Statistical tests include:
- ANOVA global test (displayed in plot)
- Pairwise t-tests against global mean (p-value symbols)
MSI_ionStatPlot.examples:
#\dontrun{

MSI_ionStatPlot(
mzpack = sample_data,
mz = 885.454,
met = intensity_list,
sampleinfo = list(
group = c("Control", "Treatment"),
id = c("S1", "S2"),
color = c("#FF0000", "#00FF00")
),
savePng = "analysis_output.png",
combine_layout = c(3, 5)
)

#}

parameters.name: mzpack
parameters.text:
An mzpack object containing MS imaging data and layer information. Must be
compatible with ggplot MS imaging functions.

parameters.name: mz
parameters.text: Target ion mass-to-charge ratio (m/z) value for imaging.

parameters.name: met
parameters.text:
List containing sample intensity data. List keys should be sample IDs with
corresponding intensity values.

parameters.name: sampleinfo
savePng
parameters.text: Output file path for PNG image. Default: "./Rplot.png".

parameters.name: ionName
parameters.text: Display title for the ion. Uses m/z value when \code{NULL} (default).

parameters.name: size
parameters.text: Image dimensions in pixels [width, height]. Default: \code{c(2400, 1000)}.

parameters.name: colorMap
parameters.text: Named list mapping group names to custom colors (overrides \code{sampleinfo$color}).

parameters.name: MSI_colorset
parameters.text: Color palette for MS imaging. Default: "viridis:turbo".

parameters.name: ggStatPlot
parameters.text: Statistical plot geometry function. Default: bar plot (\code{geom_barplot}).

parameters.name: padding_top
parameters.text: Top padding in pixels. Default: 150.

parameters.name: padding_right
parameters.text: Right padding in pixels. Default: 200.

parameters.name: padding_bottom
parameters.text: Bottom padding in pixels. Default: 150.

parameters.name: padding_left
parameters.text: Left padding in pixels. Default: 150.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.text: Spacing between statistical plot and MS image in pixels. Default: 50.

parameters.name: combine_layout
parameters.text:
Layout ratio [stat_plot_width, msi_width]. Default: \code{c(4, 5)}
(converted to 44.4% vs 55.6% of available width).

parameters.name: jitter_size
parameters.text: Point size for jittered data points. Default: 8.

parameters.name: TrIQ
parameters.text: Intensity quantile threshold (0-1) for MS image enhancement. Default: 0.65.

parameters.name: backcolor
parameters.text: Background color for MS imaging panel. Default: "black".

parameters.name: regions

MSI_ionStatPlot.title: Combined Statistical Plot and Mass Spectrometry Imaging Visualization

parameters.name: dims
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.text: NULL

parameters.text: should be the mzkit mzpack data object

parameters.name: filters
parameters.text: the raster filters for the ms-imaging spatial pixels rawdata

MSI_sampleTIC.returns:
a gdi+ raster image data object for make single ion ms-imaging
rendering as background.
MSI_sampleTIC.title: Create raster image based on the total ions thumbnail of the sample rawdata file.

npixels.description:
This function calculates the total number of MS1 scans in an mzpack object,
which corresponds to the pixel dimensions in MS imaging spatial data.
Each MS1 scan represents a spatial coordinate (pixel) in the 2D imaging plane.
npixels.details:
The function accesses the MS property of the mzpack object, which stores
a list of MS scans, and returns the count of MS1-level scans. In MS imaging,
each MS1 scan is spatially mapped to a specific (x,y) coordinate, forming
the basis for intensity-based image reconstruction.

parameters.name: raw
parameters.text:
An mzpack object containing mass spectrometry data. The object must
include MS1-level scan data in its MS property. Typically generated by
mzR or other MS data parsers that support imaging data structure.

npixels.returns:
An integer value representing the total number of pixels in the
associated MS imaging experiment. This is equivalent to the number of MS1
scans stored in the MS property of the input object.
npixels.title: Count the number of MS1 scans as imaging pixels

.auto_size_internal.description: Helper function that computes base canvas dimensions with padding and scaling.

parameters.name: dims
parameters.text: Original image dimensions (numeric vector [width, height])

parameters.name: padding
parameters.text: Numeric vector specifying padding [top, right, bottom, left]

parameters.name: scale
parameters.text: Numeric scaling factor for initial dimension adjustment

.auto_size_internal.returns:
Numeric vector [width, height] representing:
(original dimensions * scale) + padding adjustments
.auto_size_internal.title: Internal canvas dimension calculator

default_intensity_filter.description:
Processes an ion layer through a predefined sequence of intensity correction
steps including gap filling, spatial smoothing, and intensity range truncation
using Trimmed Quantile Scaling (TrIQ).

parameters.name: ion
parameters.text:
An `ion` object containing MSI data with at least a `layer` component
(raster data) and `TrIQ` field for storing scaling factors.

parameters.name: MSI_TrIQ
parameters.text:
Quantile threshold (0-1) for intensity truncation. Default 0.8
(retains intensities below 80th percentile).

default_intensity_filter.returns: Modified `ion` object with updated `layer` and `TrIQ` components.
default_intensity_filter.title: Apply Default Intensity Filtering Pipeline to MSI Ion Layer

custom_intensity_filter.description:
Processes an ion layer using user-defined raster filters followed by automatic
intensity scaling through Trimmed Quantile Scaling (TrIQ).
custom_intensity_filter.details:
Key features:
- Allows custom filter sequences via \code{apply_raster_filter()}
- Maintains automatic TrIQ scaling after custom filtering
- Preserves original object structure while updating `layer` and `TrIQ`

parameters.name: ion
parameters.text: An `ion` object containing MSI data with `layer` raster data

parameters.name: filters
parameters.text: List of raster filters to apply in sequence (function objects)

parameters.name: MSI_TrIQ
parameters.text: Quantile threshold for intensity truncation (default 0.8)

custom_intensity_filter.returns: Modified `ion` object with filtered `layer` and updated `TrIQ` values
custom_intensity_filter.title: Apply Custom Filter Sequence to MSI Ion Layer

default_MSIfilter.description:
Generates a predefined pipeline of geometric filters optimized for preprocessing
single ion mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) data. This pipeline combines multiple
image enhancement steps in a recommended sequence.
default_MSIfilter.details:
The filter pipeline is constructed using the following processing steps in sequence:
\enumerate{
\item \code{denoise_scale()}: Applies initial noise reduction to raw MSI data
\item \code{TrIQ_scale(0.99)}: Performs trimmed quantile scaling (top 1% truncated)
\item \code{knn_scale()}: Executes k-nearest neighbors smoothing
\item \code{soften_scale()}: Final edge-preserving image softening
}
The 'greater than' operator (>) is used to define processing order in this domain-specific
language. Filters are applied from left to right.
default_MSIfilter.returns:
A filter pipeline object of class 'geometric_filters' containing the
configured processing sequence. This object can be used with MSI processing
functions that accept geometric filter pipelines.
default_MSIfilter.title: Create Default Filter Pipeline for Single Ion Mass Spectrometry Imaging
